snippet: After President Obama said he would delay a military strike against Syria, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government has characterized the situation as delicate.
abstract: Israel's government offers no signs it will attempt to influence United States outcome after Pres Obama announces that he will delay military strike against Syria to obtain Congressional approval; despite country's eagerness for American military response, it is remaining silent in effort to avoid worsening a delicate political situation.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER

lead_paragraph: After President Obama said he would delay a military strike against Syria, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government has characterized the situation as delicate.

headline.main: On Obama’s Plan, a Message Emerges in Israel: Stay Quiet
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Syria Decision Greeted Silently by Israel

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
